newsitem.title: CUBA: Cuban authorities detain three dissidents.
newsitem.headline: Cuban authorities detain three dissidents.

text.p: Authorities in Cuba have detained three dissidents involved in trying to produce independent economic reports and news articles, diplomatic sources said on Wednesday.

The sources said that Marta Beatriz Roque, director of a group called the Association of Independent Economists, and journalists Tania Quintero and Juan Antonio Sanchez were detained on Tuesday afternoon near the Czech embassy, which they had apparently been visiting.
The three were under investigation at a Havana police station, the sources added. They had no other details of the case.
There was no confirmation of the detentions by Cuban authorities, who rarely comment on cases involving the communist-ruled island's small, illegal opposition groups.
The detentions coincided with a 24-hour visit by Canadian Foreign Minister Lloyd Axworthy.
Axworthy, who was leaving Cuba later Wednesday, told reporters late on Tuesday he had raised Canadian concerns about human rights during talks with President Fidel Castro.
